match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 7 wickets (with 35 balls remaining)

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor lbw b Mahmudullah 75 (73b 9x4 1x6) SR: 102.73

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front went for the reverse sweep, but the ball dipped and turned past the bat to rap him right in front. The partnership-breaker has struck for Bangladesh

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 49 (61b 3x4 2x6) SR: 80.32

dismissalComment.html: gets his revenge immediately slower ball outside off, drawing the poke. Mushfiqur had no trouble collecting the thin edge

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: got 'im No foot movement again from Hamilton, and went for the drive. It was a slower ball outside off, straightened a touch, enough to take a feather of an edge through to the keeper. Not the best shot to play when Zimbabwe's opening partnerships have been so shaky

has he bottom-edged this to the keeper? Yes, he has. Oh, dear. Zimbabwe have lost another wicket just when they looked set to accelerate. Slants this length ball across, Williams looks to use the width to cut behind point, but this kept a touch low to get the bottom edge. Three short of a fifty
caught on the point fence short ball outside off, he slashed it hard, but straight to the man

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: top edge taken back of a length offcutter on the stumps, he went for maximum but only got a top-edge off the heave. Good catch by Mehidy at wide long-on, holding on after covering some ground to his right

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mohammad Saifuddin 14 (18b 2x4 0x6) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: got 'im No foot movement again from Hamilton, and went for the drive. It was a slower ball outside off, straightened a touch, enough to take a feather of an edge through to the keeper. Not the best shot to play when Zimbabwe's opening partnerships have been so shaky

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Fazle Mahmud b Mehidy Hasan Miraz
dismissalText.commentary: Cephas Zhuwao c Fazle Mahmud b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 20 (27b 1x4 1x6) SR: 74.07

dismissalComment.html: lofted, but he's holed out to long-off. Impatience has got the better of him. Not sure why he needed to play such a stroke at a time when the runs were flowing freely, but credit to the bowler as well. Mehidy tossed it up on middle, there's a hint of drift as the batsman made room, cramped for room as a result but went through with the lofted hit and simply managed to toe-end this to long-off.

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor lbw b Mahmudullah 75 (73b 9x4 1x6) SR: 102.73

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front went for the reverse sweep, but the ball dipped and turned past the bat to rap him right in front. The partnership-breaker has struck for Bangladesh

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mohammad Saifuddin 47 (76b 2x4 0x6) SR: 61.84

dismissalComment.html: has he bottom-edged this to the keeper? Yes, he has. Oh, dear. Zimbabwe have lost another wicket just when they looked set to accelerate. Slants this length ball across, Williams looks to use the width to cut behind point, but this kept a touch low to get the bottom edge. Three short of a fifty

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Chigumbura b Sikandar Raza 90 (111b 7x4 0x6) SR: 81.08

dismissalComment.html: Kayes holes out! Was this necessary? With just a few runs needed, and ten away from what could have been two consecutive hundreds, Kayes has given it away. Chigumbura was placed down at long off, but Kayes dances down and tries to beat him with a lofted drive, but he wasn't quite to the pitch and didn't get all of it. In fact, the ball was dying in front of Chigumbura and he had to get in quickly to catch it. Raza strikes again, but is it too little too late?

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Donald Tiripano player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Donald Tiripano player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Tiripano b Sikandar Raza 83 (77b 12x4 1x6) SR: 107.79

dismissalComment.html: steps out and slices this straight to cover point. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball but went through with the stroke. Raza got this to drift away a wee bit, hence ended up eliciting a slice and this is nicely taken at the edge of the ring. Muted celebration, Liton has missed a great opportunity at making a hundred here. Bangladesh lose one against the run of play.

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: steps out and slices this straight to cover point. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball but went through with the stroke. Raza got this to drift away a wee bit, hence ended up eliciting a slice and this is nicely taken at the edge of the ring. Muted celebration, Liton has missed a great opportunity at making a hundred here. Bangladesh lose one against the run of play.

What's happened here? Is this a stumping? Raza floated one up and Mahmud skipped out to meet the ball, but he over-balanced and missed it. Taylor juggles his take, and by the time he can disturb the bails (his arms tucked up like chicken wings to hold the ball), Mahmud is scurrying back to the crease. The third umpire is brought into service, and he's short!

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

Chigumbura was placed down at long off, but Kayes dances down and tries to beat him with a lofted drive, but he wasn't quite to the pitch and didn't get all of it. In fact, the ball was dying in front of Chigumbura and he had to get in quickly to catch it. Raza strikes again, but is it too little too late?

commentPreTextItems.html: Darun: "Feeling a bit gutted for Fazle, getting ducks in his first two ODI's. Knowing the management, they'll probably have Sarkar coming in for him. Hopefully this doesn't mark the end of his international run, he's had tons of experience in domestic cricket."

commentTextItems.html: game, set, match and the series! This is a friendly long-hop, he rocks back to open up the leg side and muscles this short delivery to clear deep square.

commentPostTextItems.html: Bangladesh's bowlers fought back to restrict Zimbabwe to 246 for 7 after Zimbabwe looked well set to double their 30-overs score of 147 for 2. Mohammad Saifuddin, playing in only his second ODI, picked three wickets to play a key role in bottling up pressure and scything through with the wickets after Brendan Taylor top scored with 75. Then with the chase, Imrul Kayes and Liton Das helped make light work of the chase by putting together 144. Both missed out on richly-deserved centuries, but by then, there was little doubt as to which side was favourite to win. Zimbabwe have a lot of soul-searching to do.
Mohammad Saifuddin is Player of the Match for his three-wicket haul
Mashrafe Mortaza: Winning the toss was crucial. We knew about the dew, but the bowlers were superb. Our openers started very well, this was a good wicket and we knew 270-280 was gettable.
Hamilton Masakadza: Didn't manage to kick on after a good start, credit to Bangladesh's death bowling. We have to grab our chances at this level, their openers batted us out of the game.

commentTextItems.html: skids back in from outside off, defended back

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: nurdles this towards the man coming in from square leg
steps out and works this down to mid-on, he was already three steps outside the crease so completed the run very easily even though mid-on was inside the ring
skids one back in on a length, defended.
too short, he rocks back and slaps this into the wide long-on boundary. Within one more boundary of victory and a series win
drills the drive to cover.
stands tall and defends back.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: eased behind point, looks for a single but is sent back
slower length ball outside off, once again he opens the face of the bat to hit this very fine. Heavy dew so the ball just chugs along, the fielder can't stop despite a slide
this time, he plays the delicate little late cut towards third man who is square, so they jog back for the second. Mushfiqur ran right down the middle of the pitch but escaps the umpire's hawkeyes
deflects this length delivery towards point, swift work by the man inside the ring by running to his left.

commentPreTextItems.html: How many more overs will these two take?
Naseef: "After mistaking Donald Tiripano for he-who-must-not-be-named I have done myself one better and read Tendai Chataraas "Tendulkar"!! Bless me again."

commentTextItems.html: steers this length delivery behind point for an easy single
clears his front leg and eases this with the spin to long-off.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: short and angling in towards middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket
eases this with the angle towards midwicket
too much flight, drills this straight to cover.
right in his swinging arc but he slices this lofted hit to sweeper cover.
eased down to long-on for a single, but hey, wait. He has over-stepped. Cardinal sin. Free-hit coming up
tossed up and drifting in from around the stumps, defended back.

Slants this length ball across, Williams looks to use the width to cut behind point, but this kept a touch low to get the bottom edge. Three short of a fifty

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 49 (61b 3x4 2x6) SR: 80.32

dismissalComment.html: gets his revenge immediately slower ball outside off, drawing the poke. Mushfiqur had no trouble collecting the thin edge

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Mustafizur Rahman 17 (20b 2x4 0x6) SR: 85

dismissalComment.html: top edge taken back of a length offcutter on the stumps, he went for maximum but only got a top-edge off the heave. Good catch by Mehidy at wide long-on, holding on after covering some ground to his right

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nazmul Islam b Mohammad Saifuddin
dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Nazmul Islam b Mohammad Saifuddin 3 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: caught on the point fence short ball outside off, he slashed it hard, but straight to the man

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Donald Tiripano player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Donald Tiripano player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Tiripano b Sikandar Raza 83 (77b 12x4 1x6) SR: 107.79

dismissalComment.html: steps out and slices this straight to cover point. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball but went through with the stroke. Raza got this to drift away a wee bit, hence ended up eliciting a slice and this is nicely taken at the edge of the ring. Muted celebration, Liton has missed a great opportunity at making a hundred here. Bangladesh lose one against the run of play.

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Chigumbura b Sikandar Raza 90 (111b 7x4 0x6) SR: 81.08

dismissalComment.html: Kayes holes out! Was this necessary? With just a few runs needed, and ten away from what could have been two consecutive hundreds, Kayes has given it away. Chigumbura was placed down at long off, but Kayes dances down and tries to beat him with a lofted drive, but he wasn't quite to the pitch and didn't get all of it. In fact, the ball was dying in front of Chigumbura and he had to get in quickly to catch it. Raza strikes again, but is it too little too late?

dismissalText.commentary: Fazle Mahmud st †Taylor b Sikandar Raza 0 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: What's happened here? Is this a stumping? Raza floated one up and Mahmud skipped out to meet the ball, but he over-balanced and missed it. Taylor juggles his take, and by the time he can disturb the bails (his arms tucked up like chicken wings to hold the ball), Mahmud is scurrying back to the crease. The third umpire is brought into service, and he's short!

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim not out 40 (52b 2x4 1x6) SR: 76.92

stories.title: 'There's a long way left for me' - Saifuddin
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: 'There's a long way left for me' - Mohammad Saifuddin
stories.summary: He said that he wanted to "show something" since he was playing in place of Rubel Hossain

stories.title: Eyeing series win, Bangladesh seek top-order solidity
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Eyeing series win, Bangladesh seek top-order solidity
stories.summary: Zimbabwe have been somewhat unsettled, and they'll need their batsmen to come good in a must-win second ODI

stories.title: Mashrafe Mortaza promises to back Fazle Mahmud despite duck on debut
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Mashrafe Mortaza promises to back Fazle Mahmud despite duck on debut
stories.summary: The hosts are looking to clinch a series-winning victory in Chittagong on Wednesday, but their captain remained keen on trying out young players for the second ODI

stories.summary: Zimbabwe are having trouble closing out games, according to their head coach, but he's backing them to deliver in the second ODI against Bangladesh
